definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)

sentences.english: We must mobilize all national resources to prevent the infectious disease.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须动用所有国家资源来防堵这种传染病。

sentences.english: A presentation is given of the industrial use of the NCI anti blocking agent in desulfurizers.
sentences.chinese: 介绍了NCI防堵剂在脱硫装置上的工业应用情况。

sentences.english: Whatever measures are taken to ward off cosmic rays should also protect against these solar tempests .
sentences.chinese: 任何防堵宇宙射线的措施，都该考虑到这些太阳风暴。

sentences.english: A design way of intelligent blocking control appliance is put forward.
sentences.chinese: 给出了一种智能防堵控制装置的设计方法。

sentences.english: A dam is a barrier holding water back.
sentences.chinese: 水坝是防堵水的障碍物。

definition: (Tw) to combat (bullying, money laundering etc)/to counter
to adopt or carry out (measures, policies, course of action)/to take
to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
to hold back/to check (i.e. to stop sb's advance)/to resist/esp. with negative, irresistible, unstoppable etc
to dredge/to open up a path for/to remove obstructions/to clear the way/to enlighten/persuasion
to root out/to eradicate/to sweep away/to abolish
